title: FA Cup fans in sick brawl in the middle of the street | united kingdom | News
body_text:
Shocking ugly brawl breaks out between furious FA Cup fans in the middle of the street
The Met Police are investigating the disturbing violence that erupted between a group of men in Harrow this afternoon.
Manchester United vs Manchester City fans in Harrow, NW London today pic.twitter.com/o8d1PM7oAK
— UB1UB2 West London (Southall) (@UB1UB2) May 25, 2024
A London street was turned into a boxing ring this afternoon as rival football supporters exchanged punches in the middle of the road bringing traffic to a standstill.
In front of a double-decker bus a large group of men, believed to be rival Manchester United and City fans in the capital for the FA Cup final, brawled and attacked one another as bemused locals looked on.
One shirtless man could be seen falling to the ground as another man tried to lift him up by his arm as more men wrestled around them on the asphalt.
Traffic was forced to a stop as the hooligans continued fighting one another, with several pitched battles ongoing between individuals exchanging blows.
The shirtless man at one point lay seemingly motionless on the road as several women appeared to try and diffuse the situation. In a statement, the Metropolitan Police said "investigations were ongoing".
The force added: “Police were made aware of this incident and officers were deployed to the area."
The ugly scenes come as Manchester United secured a surprise 2-1 victory against Premier League Champions Manchester City.
Before the game photographs showed a large police presence and some scuffles between officers and some fans who had appeared to have let emotion of fixture get the better of them.
Prince William and his son George made a welcome appearance with the pair gripped as they watched the Mancunian derby unfold.

In a statement to Express.co.uk the Metropolitan Police said it would be issuing figures around the game later today, but before the match the force said: "We want people to enjoy the game safely, so please remember there is a controlled drinking zone in the streets around the stadium.
"Our officers will be proactively engaging with fans and if they are drinking in banned areas, will be asked to surrender their alcohol."
Manchester United have now won their 13th FA Cup in the tournament's 143-year existence, a record second only to Arsenal. It means the Red Devils now qualify for the UEFA Europa League.
